description: PHP remote file include vulnerability in functions_admin.php in Virtual War (VWar) 1.5.0 R10 allows remote attackers to include and execute arbitrary PHP code via unspecified attack vectors.  NOTE: this issue has been referred to as XSS, but it is clear from the vendor description that it is a file inclusion problem.

cvss3.cvss3_url: No Common Vulnerability Scoring System Version for CVE=CVE-2005-4748

description: HTTP request smuggling vulnerability in BEA WebLogic Server and WebLogic Express 8.1 SP4 and earlier, 7.0 SP6 and earlier, and 6.1 SP7 and earlier allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary HTTP headers via unspecified attack vectors.

cvss3.cvss3_url: No Common Vulnerability Scoring System Version for CVE=CVE-2005-4749

description: BEA WebLogic Server and WebLogic Express 8.1 SP4 and earlier, 7.0 SP5 and earlier, and 6.1 SP7 and earlier allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (server thread hang) via unknown attack vectors.

cvss3.cvss3_url: No Common Vulnerability Scoring System Version for CVE=CVE-2005-4750

description: Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in BEA WebLogic Server and WebLogic Express 9.0, 8.1 SP4 and earlier, 7.0 SP6 and earlier, and 6.1 SP7 and earlier allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML and gain administrative privileges via unknown attack vectors.

cvss3.cvss3_url: No Common Vulnerability Scoring System Version for CVE=CVE-2005-4751

description: BEA WebLogic Server and WebLogic Express 8.1 SP4 and earlier, and 7.0 SP6 and earlier, might allow local users to gain privileges by using the run-as deployment descriptor element to change the privileges of a web application or EJB from the Deployer security role to the Admin security role.

cvss3.cvss3_url: No Common Vulnerability Scoring System Version for CVE=CVE-2005-4752

description: BEA WebLogic Server and WebLogic Express 8.1 SP4 and earlier, and 7.0 SP6 and earlier, in certain "heavy usage" scenarios, report incorrect severity levels for an audit event, which might allow attackers to perform unauthorized actions and avoid detection.

cvss3.cvss3_url: No Common Vulnerability Scoring System Version for CVE=CVE-2005-4753

description: BEA WebLogic Server and WebLogic Express 8.1 SP3 and earlier allow remote attackers to obtain sensitive information (intranet IP addresses) via unknown attack vectors involving "network address translation."

cvss3.cvss3_url: No Common Vulnerability Scoring System Version for CVE=CVE-2005-4754

description: BEA WebLogic Server and WebLogic Express 8.1 SP3 and earlier (1) stores the private key passphrase (CustomTrustKeyStorePassPhrase) in cleartext in nodemanager.config; or, during domain creation with the Configuration Wizard, renders an SSL private key passphrase in cleartext (2) on a terminal or (3) in a log file, which might allow local users to obtain cryptographic keys.

cvss3.cvss3_url: No Common Vulnerability Scoring System Version for CVE=CVE-2005-4755

description: BEA WebLogic Server and WebLogic Express 8.1 SP4 and earlier, and 7.0 SP5 and earlier, do not properly validate derived Principals with multiple PrincipalValidators, which might allow attackers to gain privileges.

cvss3.cvss3_url: No Common Vulnerability Scoring System Version for CVE=CVE-2005-4756

description: BEA WebLogic Server and WebLogic Express 8.1 SP3 and earlier, and 7.0 SP5 and earlier, do not properly "constrain" a "/" (slash) servlet root URL pattern, which might allow remote attackers to bypass intended servlet protections.

cvss3.cvss3_url: No Common Vulnerability Scoring System Version for CVE=CVE-2005-4757

description: Unspecified vulnerability in the Administration server in BEA WebLogic Server and WebLogic Express 8.1 SP3 and earlier allows remote authenticated Admin users to read arbitrary files via unknown attack vectors related to an "internal servlet" accessed through HTTP.

cvss3.cvss3_url: No Common Vulnerability Scoring System Version for CVE=CVE-2005-4758

description: BEA WebLogic Server and WebLogic Express 8.1 and 7.0, during a migration across operating system platforms, do not warn the administrative user about platform differences in URLResource case sensitivity, which might cause local users to inadvertently lose protection of Web Application pages.

cvss3.cvss3_url: No Common Vulnerability Scoring System Version for CVE=CVE-2005-4759

description: BEA WebLogic Server and WebLogic Express 8.1 SP3 and earlier, and 7.0 SP5 and earlier, when fullyDelegatedAuthorization is enabled for a servlet, does not cause servlet deployment to fail when failures occur in authorization or role providers, which might prevent the servlet from being "fully protected."

cvss3.cvss3_url: No Common Vulnerability Scoring System Version for CVE=CVE-2005-4760

description: BEA WebLogic Server and WebLogic Express 8.1 SP4 and earlier, 7.0 SP5 and earlier, and 6.1 SP7 and earlier log the Java command line at server startup, which might include sensitive information (passwords or keyphrases) in the server log file when the -D option is used.

cvss3.cvss3_url: No Common Vulnerability Scoring System Version for CVE=CVE-2005-4761

description: BEA WebLogic Server and WebLogic Express 8.1 SP4 and earlier, 7.0 SP6 and earlier, and 6.1 SP7 and earlier sometimes stores the boot password in the registry in cleartext, which might allow local users to gain administrative privileges.

cvss3.cvss3_url: No Common Vulnerability Scoring System Version for CVE=CVE-2005-4762

description: BEA WebLogic Server and WebLogic Express 8.1 SP4 and earlier, 7.0 SP6 and earlier, and 6.1 SP7 and earlier, when Internet Inter-ORB Protocol (IIOP) is used, sometimes include a password in an exception message that is sent to a client or stored in a log file, which might allow remote attackers to perform unauthorized actions.

cvss3.cvss3_url: No Common Vulnerability Scoring System Version for CVE=CVE-2005-4763
